name: Buck Hill
comments: Jazz tenor and soprano saxophonist.  Hill was called the "Wailin' Mailman" because he kept his day job as a Washington, D.C. mailman for over thirty years, refusing to give up this gig even after achieving success as a professional musician.

name: Alan Dawson
comments: Jazz drummer and respected teacher (Berklee School of Music: 1957-1975). He was an early teacher of Tony Williams . Unlike high-profile drummers like Max Roach and Roy Haynes, Dawson stayed a sideman, who recorded only one album as a leader.

name: The Cousins [BE]
comments: Rock band that took its name from a music club at the Grand Place in Brussels. For legal reasons the band was named 'The Continental Cousins' in some territories. Lead by the brothers André and Guy Van den Meerschaut.

name: Isabel
comments: Choirgirl at York Minster wo became the youngest classical recording artist signed by Decca after winning its nationwide search to find Britain's most musically-talented choirgirl

name: Ashley Park [CA]
comments: Brainchild of Terry Miles (with help from Kelly Haigh, etc)

name: Puggy
comments: Pop-rock trio started in Belgium by English Matthew Irons, French Romain Descampe and Swedish Egil “Ziggy” Franzén

name: Tyree Glenn
aliases: Tyree Glenn with Voices and Brass
comments: Jazz trombonist and occasional jazz vibraphonist

name: Alba Fossati
comments: Italian dancer and actressAires, born in Argentia of two Italian emigrants she left to Italy in 1946. She took the decision to leave the world of the show in 1956 dedicating herself to the composition of about 250 songs.

name: Paul Muggleton
comments: Guitar, vocalist and keyboarder better known as a successful producer and arranger

name: Bunny Sigler
comments: Soul singer, songwriter and record producer from Philadelphia, PA.

name: John Starks
comments: Funk and blues drummer and songwriter, best known for playing with James Brown.

name: Ahmet Ertegun
comments: Born in Turkey, his family moved to the United States in 1935.  When his father, a Turkish diplomat died in 1944, his family returned to Turkey, except Ahmet and a brother.  Ertegun was the founder of Atlantic Records .

name: Woodrow Cunningham Jr.
comments: Vocalist, producr and drummer from Baltimore

name: Deanie Parker
comments: Singer, songwriter and Stax label record executive

name: Jerome Bell [US1]
comments: Funk and soul vocalist, songwriter and keyboard player

name: Gene McFadden
comments: Soul singer, songwriter, and record producer

name: Kevin McCord
comments: Soul and R&B singer-songwriter and producer

name: Pat Lewis
comments: R&B singer who was very popular on the northern soul scene

name: Frank Brunson
comments: Soul and rhythm & blues singer, songwriter and musician. In 2002 he was inducted into the Buffalo Music Hall of Fame.

name: Giacomo Puccini
personal_name: Giacomo Antonio Domenico Michele Secondo Maria Puccini
comments: Opera composer,  who has been called "the greatest composer of Italian opera after Verdi". Puccini's most renowned works are La bohème (1896), Tosca (1900), Madama Butterfly (1904), and Turandot (1926), all of which are among the important operas played as standards.

name: Léo Delibes
comments: Composer born in Saint-Germain-du-Val, Sarthe, best known for his ballets and operas

name: Steve Arrington
comments: Drummer, singer, songwriter, engineer, and record producer.

name: Freddie Perren
comments: Musician, record producer, songwriter, arranger, and orchestra conductor.

name: Keni St Lewis
comments: Soul and disco singer, and songwriter

name: Claude Debussy
comments: French composer. He and Maurice Ravel were the most prominent figures associated with Impressionist music.

name: George Jackson [US1]
comments: Funk/soul/blues singer-songwriter and producer. After performing in the 1960s, he settled into Muscle Shoals primarily as a songwriter and producer for Fame Recordings and later for Malaco Records.

name: Friedrich von Flotow
personal_name: Friedrich Adolf Ferdinand, Freiherr von Flotow
comments: Classical composer born in Teutendorf in Mecklenburg, who is best remembered for his 1847 opera "Martha, oder Der Markt zu Richmond".

name: Jules Barbier
comments: Poet, writer and opera librettist who often wrote in collaboration with Michel Carré. He was a noted Parisian bon vivant and man of letters.

name: Michel Carré [FR1]
comments: Librettist. Worked often together with Jules Barbier.

name: Harold Brown
comments: Drummer, singer, and songwriter, born in Long Beach, California

name: Lee Oskar
comments: Harmonica player, singer and songwriter. Born in Copenhagen, he came to the US at age 18.

name: Adrienne Anderson
comments: Lyricist, most notable for being the co-writer of "Could It Be Magic", among other Barry Manilow songs, as well as being the co-writer of signature songs for Dionne Warwick ("Déjà Vu") and Peter Allen ("I Go to Rio"). She has had a continuing association with Barry Manilow that goes back to his first album, released in July, 1973.

name: Kevin Toney
comments: Pianist and composer/arranger.  Toney played jazz-fusion and contemporary jazz.

name: Larry Mizell
comments: Musician, songwriter, arranger and producer. In the 1970s Larry formed a successful production duo together with his brother Fonce, The Mizell Brothers. Both retired from the music business in the early 1980s.

name: Gustav Mahler
comments: An Austro-Bohemian late-Romantic composer and one of the leading conductors of his generation. While in his lifetime his status as a conductor was established beyond question his own music gained wide popularity only after periods of relative neglect which included a ban on its performance in much of Europe during the Nazi era. After 1945 his compositions were rediscovered by a new generation of listeners and he then became one of the most frequently performed and recorded of all composers, a position he has sustained into the 21st century.

name: Edvard Grieg
aliases: Symphony Orchestra conducted by Edvard Grieg

name: Robby Robinson
comments: Keyboardist, arranger, conductor, producer, and songwriter

name: Jerry Huffman
comments: Guitarist who performed with Charlie Feathers

name: Nevio
comments: Pop- rock music singer Season 3 finalist of Deutschland sucht den SuperStar [4th place]

name: Stephan Darnstaedt
comments: Pop-rock music singer Season 3 finalist of Deutschland sucht den SuperStar [later withdrawn]

name: Siniestro Total
comments: Galician punk rock group from Vigo.

name: Xavier Soto
comments: Spanish guitar and keyboard player, member of "Os Resentidos" and later "Siniestro Total", since 1985.

name: The Secret Police
comments: Assembly of musicians performing "I Shall Be Released" at a series of Amnesty International benefit concerts at the Theatre Royal, London in September, 1981

name: Johnnie Fingers
comments: Keyboard player from Dún Laoghaire, Dublin, who co-founded The Boomtown Rats with Bob Geldof.

name: Sondre Bratland
comments: Folk singer and song teacher from Vinje. He has performed traditional songs from Setesdal and Telemark, collected religious folk tunes and composed music to songs by poets such as Olav H. Hauge and Tarjei Vesaas.

name: Bill Harris [US4]
aliases: Bill Harris and His New Music

name: Serge Chaloff
comments: Chaloff, the son of professional musicians from Boston, was the first major bebop player on the baritone saxophone. Unfortunately, he was very difficult to work with due to his heroin addiction. After kicking the habit, he died shortly thereafter of spinal cancer.

name: Charlie Skarbek
comments: One of the more significant éminences grises in British popular music. He never features as principal performer, but his name nevertheless appears in the credits for numerous tracks and albums. His particular speciality, of putting pop lyrics to famous classical musical themes and hymn tunes,

name: Rick Blaskey
comments: Producer, record label executive and songwriter

name: Johnny Cole
comments: Rochester, New York-born singer, active in the 1960s, and songwriter

name: Jimmie Cross
comments: Dothan, Alabama-born radio producer, who as a singer released 3 singles and did some songwriting.

name: Charles Parker
comments: Best known as a radio producer for BBC Radio, he was also a singer, writer and actor.

name: John Hasted
comments: Important to the English folk revival, Hasted was responsible for many of the early folk clubs.  Hasted was also a folk musician and one of Great Britain's leading physicists.

name: The Call
comments: Rock band formed in Santa Cruz, California

name: Riccardo Pazzaglia
comments: Naples-born writer, lyricist, actor, director, and television personality, best known for his artistic collaboration with Renzo Arbore.

name: Silvio Testi
comments: Television and record producer, artistic director, lyricist.

name: Heather Parisi
comments: Dancer, television presenter and singer. In 1979, while she was on holiday in Italy, she was scouted by the choreographer Franco Miseria and became a celebrity there.

name: Corrado Lojacono
comments: Singer and composer born in Palermo, who was particularly famous in the 1950s and 1960s.

name: Remo Germani
aliases: Remo Germani e i suoi Rangers
Remo Germani ed i suoi Rangers

name: Jovert
comments: Group of steel pan bands based in Tucson, Arizona.

name: Vladimír Čort
comments: Lyricist and writer born in Ostrava

name: Flamingo [CZ]
comments: Soul/funk/pop group. Formed in Ostrava and led by Richard Kovalčík until his death in 1975. During this first period the group’s lineup was essentially identical to the nucleus of the Ostravský rozhlasový orchestr and many recordings performed by the latter could have been actually credited to Flamingo.

name: Hewlett, Anderson & Waslousky
comments: Soft pop trio: Peter Hewlett, Scott Anderson & Joe Waslousky

name: Jiggernaut
comments: Celtic music/rock band based in Texas.

name: Sandrine Piau
comments: Classical soprano vocalist born in Issy-les-Moulineaux, Hauts-de-Seine

name: Raphaël Imbert
comments: Saxophonist, conductor and composer born in Thiais

name: Deborah Dixon
aliases: Deborah Dixon & The Take Five Movement
comments: Vocalist born in Costa Rica but resident in Argentina since 1984.

name: Nova Bossa Ltd.
aliases: Nova Bossa Ltd. & Mayla Da Viola
comments: Quarteto Nova Bossa is a bossa quartet that hails from Rio de Janeiro hood of Flamengo. They first entered the studio to create a jazzy version of the Musica Popular do Brasil (MPB) hit Mais que nada. They decided that they liked the soundboard so much that they jumped at the chance to return and participate in a unique crossover project creating bossa nova versions of K Pop hits (Bossa n' K-pop). Joining forces with artists like Lee Avril, Os Alquimistas and others, they took the leap and brought a touch of Brazil to Korean Pop.

name: Maíra Lemos
comments: Teen singer and Season 2 runner-up of "Fama"

name: Knock Out [US]
comments: Hailing from Riverside, California, blending Punk, Ska, Reggae, and dub-style Hip-Hop

name: Walter Sear
comments: Synthesizerist, producer and theremin player, engineer and entrepreneur

name: Betty and Karen
comments: Vocal duo formed in New York City in 1966. They only released one single on MGM Records.

name: Betty Ameche
comments: Singer who formed the vocal duo Betty and Karen together with Karen Segalla in 1966. They only released one single on MGM Records. She is the niece of the actor Don Ameche.

name: The G-Clefs
comments: Doo-wop group from Boston, formed by three brothers, Teddy, Chris, and Timmy Scott, their cousin Joe Jordan and their friend Ray Gipson.

name: Moogetmoogs
comments: Rock band around Mauri "Moog" Konttinen; active from 1985 till 1993.

name: Andrea Guerra
comments: Composer, noted for his film scores of Facing Windows (2003), Hotel Rwanda (2004), and The Pursuit of Happyness (2006)

name: Elisa Di Ganci
comments: Singer from Palermo and contestant in kids talent TV show io canto in 2010

name: SullivanBurton
comments: Celtic/folk music duo of Shannan Sullivan (fiddle) and Bruce Burton (guitar), based in Peoria, Illinois.

name: I Combos
comments: Studio musicians hired by the Italian label Combo . They served as backing band for solo singers and also performed covers of Italian hit songs of the period.

name: Mari Nakamoto
comments: Jazz vocalist; Nakamoto sings in English.

name: Art Kahn
comments: Musician, composer and bandleader. His orchestra was one of early jazz recording groups during the Roaring Twenties.

name: Judy Carmichael
comments: Swing and stride pianist and occasional vocalist

name: Sabina Ciuffini
comments: Argentinian born showgirl and TV hostess

name: Lyle Ritz
aliases: Lyle Ritz and His Jazz Ukulele
comments: Ukulele and bass player.  Originally from Cleveland, Ohio, Ritz recorded two jazz ukulele albums for Verve in the 1950s.  There was little interest in the records outside of Hawaii so Ritz began playing primarily bass, and was recorded at over 5,000 sessions.  In the mid-1980s, Ritz began playing the ukulele again.  In 2007, he was inducted into The Ukulele Hall of Fame.

name: George Wein
aliases: George Wein and the Storyville Sextet
comments: Best known as a jazz promoter, Wein established several jazz festivals, including the Newport Jazz Festival and organized several different groups using the name "Newport All Stars".  Wein is also a jazz pianist.

name: Mark Salling
comments: Dallas, TX born actor and singer.

name: The Frankenstein Drag Queens From Planet 13
Kasenetz-Katz Singing Orchestral Circus
comments: Bubblegum "supergroup" put together by record producers Jerry Kasenetz and Jeff Katz, made up of various members from their Super K Productions company. The "Orchestral Cirkus" group was an anonymous group of musicians performing arrangements of classical music pieces.

name: David Weiss
aliases: David Weiss with Members of the Los Angeles Philarmonic
comments: Flute and woodwinds player, New York-based

name: Bloodrock
comments: Hard rock band, based in Fort Worth, Texas

name: Realm
comments: Metal band from Milwaukee, Wisconsin in existence from 1985 to 1992.

name: Mikko Alatalo
comments: Musician and prolific songwriter from Tampere. In more recent times he has had an career as a politician.

name: Dean Elliott
aliases: Arranged and conducted by Dean Elliott
comments: Composer of TV, film and cartoon music, commercials and bandleader born in Sioux City, Iowa

name: Eero Raittinen
aliases: Eero Raittinen & the Noisy Kinda Men
Eero Raittinen and the Noisy Kinda Men
comments: Pop, rock, blues singer and drummer

name: Jukka Kuoppamäki
comments: Singer-songwriter, sometimes influenced by the California folk sound. In the 1970s he founded the record label Satsanga and later he moved to Germany where he became a Christian priest.

name: Harry Tobias
comments: Lyricist, who wrote lyrics for Hollywood movies - from 1929 into the 1940s - and for several jazz standards. Tobias was also a noted music publisher working closely with his brothers Charles and Henry Tobias. Inducted in 1983 into the 'Songwriters Hall of Fame'.

name: Kenny Baker [GB]
aliases: Kenny Baker and The Baker's Dozen
comments: Known principally as a jazz trumpeter, he also played cornet and flugelhorn and composed music

name: The Flowerz
comments: Poppy garage band with an organ-dominated sound from Reading, Pennsylvania.

name: Emmett Berry
comments: Berry was a jazz trumpeter, playing mostly as a sideman, including, most notably, with Fletcher Henderson's Orchestra

name: Recoil
comments: The solo project of ex Depeche Mode's Alan Wilder.

name: Captain Ahab
comments: Electropop/experimental duo, Jonathan Snipes and Jim Merson. They are based in Los Angeles.

name: Reverse Osmosis
comments: A cappella group from the University of Southern California

name: The Crabs Corporation
comments: Retro reggae band based in Buenos Aires.

name: Nylon 66'ers
comments: Instrumental rock band, who mostly play covers with a characteristic organ-sound. They started by playing rhythm and blues, but later expanded to other genres such as rock, disco, soul, jazz, techno, latin music and heavy metal.

name: Steve Wilson [US1]
comments: Starting his career in music as a teenager, Wilson played saxophone in funk and R&B bands.  After a stint at university majoring in music, he moved to New York City where he played jazz saxophone and flute as a sideman. He has now released several albums as leader.

name: Leo Caerts Jr.
comments: Musician (piano, keyboards, synthesizer), composer and producer

name: Sten & Stanley
comments: Dansband from Karlskoga, Sweden, formed in 1962 by the brothers Sten, Ebbe and Per Nilsson with Stanley Granström and Bo Carlén. Since the late 1970s mainly run by Sten and Ebbe Nilsson with changing musicians and additional singers, who partly also act as a featured or backing band/choir on releases by Sten and vice versa.

name: Ossi Ahlapuro
comments: Actor and singer born in Viipuri or Vyborg (presently Выборг).

name: Eddie Costa
comments: Jazz pianist and vibraphonist who died tragically young in a car crash

name: Tommy Gumina
comments: Jazz accordion player born in Milwaukee

name: Bill Evans [US2]
comments: Multi-instrumentalist who plays principally tenor and soprano saxes.  He plays a wide variety of music, including jazz, fusion, and funk.

name: Ivo Fischer
comments: Eminent lyricist, radio personality and literary manager. Born in Letky (now Libčice nad Vltavou).

name: Vándor Kálmán
comments: Journalist and lyricist. His career began in 1942 as sports journalist and in the late fifties he began to write lyrics.

name: Waldemar Matuška
comments: Acclaimed singer and actor, who also appeared in several films. Born in Košice (now in Slovakia), he spent his childhood in Prague. In 1986 he emigrated to USA.

name: Pál Szécsi
comments: Singer, arguably one of the most popular Hungarian singers of all times achieving unprecedenced cult status during his lifetime. His growing domestic popularity was increasingly harder to bear for the mentally fragile singer, and this led to Szécsi becoming more and more closed off from the outer world. He attempted suicide eight times, but always asked for help at the last minute. His ninth attempt on 30 April 1974, was successful. Szécsi was only 30 years old.

name: James Iotti
comments: Italian-born singer, who migrated to Hilversum in the Netherlands in 1962. Active as a recording artist in the 1960s and 1970s.

name: Sonja Salvis
comments: Vocalist born in Bern. Around 1970 she was touring and recording with the Czechoslovak Gustav Brom Orchestra

name: Gustav Brom
comments: Big band leader, arranger, composer, clarinetist and occasional singer. Born in Veľké Leváre (Western Slovakia).

name: Laurie Johnson
comments: Bandleader and composer of music for films and television

name: Ron Hellard
comments: Singer/songwriter and guitarist born in Versailles, Kentucky

name: Elisa Gabbai
comments: A folk and pop singer who found success both in her native country and in Germany and Switzerland singing schlager Mother of Daphna Dove

name: Hans-Jürgen Bäumler
comments: Actor, singer, television host and former pair skater born in Dachau, Bavaria. He became famous in pair skating with his skating partner Marika Kilius.

name: Warzone
comments: New York hardcore punk band fronted by Raymond "Raybeez" Barbieri, the band's only consistent member.

name: Dalton
comments: "Supergroup" starring Johnny Madsen, Lars Lilholt and Allan Olsen. All of them, already major solo acts, teamed up in 1992 for an album and tour. This spare time group however became very popular. The trio besides performing together also found pleasure in heavy drinking while touring giving the trio a reputation as a sort of the Rat Pack of provincial rock. After tending their individual careers they teamed up again in 2010 for a new album and touring again.

name: Kari Kuuva
comments: Singer, composer and lyricist from Tampere.

name: Rubén Juárez
aliases: Rubén Juárez con acomp. de orq.

name: Pete Morton
comments: Folk singer and singer-songwriter of his own material.

name: Joe Morello
aliases: Joe Morello with His Sextet and Orchestra
comments: Jazz drummer best known for his stint from 1956 to 1967 with the The Dave Brubeck Quartet

name: Bill Perkins
aliases: Bill Perkins Quintet featuring Victor Feldman
comments: Wind instrument player, including tenor and baritone saxes, flute, and clarinet. He's associated with the cool school of West Coast jazz.

name: Lola Ponce
comments: Pop music singer, actress and model

name: Low Low Low La La La Love Love Love
Male
comments: Group from Chicago with two core members, Jonathan Krohn and Benjamin Mjolsness.

name: Grant Stewart
comments: Jazz tenor saxophonist born in Toronto

name: Daniela Mercury
aliases: Daniela Mercury & Cabeça de Nós Todos
comments: Axé, samba-reggae and MPB singer, songwriter and record producer

name: Donald Bailey
comments: Jazz drummer who has principally been recorded as a sideman.  He also occasionally plays harmonica.

name: Joe Berluck
aliases: The Erotic Voice of Joe Berluck
comments: Parlando singer, DJ and radio host

name: Koerner, Ray & Glover
aliases: John Koerner, Dave Ray and Tony Glover
comments: Influential folk & blues trio from Minneapolis.

name: Lennie Tristano
comments: Jazz pianist, composer, and influential teacher, his pupils included Lee Konitz and Bill Evans .  The complexities of his harmonies were even more advanced than the bebop music in vogue in his early recording record.  He recorded in many jazz styles, including bebop, cool jazz, post-bop, and avant-garde jazz.

name: Per Henrik Wallin
comments: Jazz piano player and composer.  Wallin experienced a severe accident in 1988, which left him wheelchair bound and kept him away from music for some eight years.

name: James Williams
comments: Jazz pianist and teacher, who died of liver cancer

name: Tine Midtgaard
comments: Pop music singer Season 3 runner-up of the Danish edition of X Factor

name: Crummy Stuff
comments: Melodic punk rock band from Milan

name: Thee S.T.P.
comments: Started in the province of Novara as a Ramones cover band, punk rock'n'roll. Celebrated as one of the hottest act in Italy ever, they also invented Speed Glam, an exctiting blend of punk rock, 70s Glitter Rock and good ol' straight rock'n'roll.

name: Love Seed Mama Jump
comments: Rock band based in Dewey Beach, Delaware

name: Alvin Alcorn
aliases: Alvin Alcorn and His Friends in Belgium
Alvin Alcorn and His New Orleans Jazz Band

name: Jason & Nolan
comments: Identical twins Jason & Nolan Livesay are an electric violin duo, award-winning composers, orchestrators, and conductors for film, television, video games, Broadway, and theme parks

name: The Bad Shepherds
aliases: Ade Edmondson and The Bad Shepherds
comments: Punk/alt/folk trio that plays traditional Celtic instruments.

name: The Three O'Clock
comments: Neo-psychedelic band, leaders of the so-called "Paisley Underground" movement

name: Goodfinger
comments: Alt rock band based in New York

name: Aleksandar Korać
comments: Serbian songwriter, composer and university professor born in Belgrade, who is best know for his numerous schlager-music contributions and his work in broadcasting.

name: Pasi Kaunisto
comments: Singer and musician (piano, drums, bass) from Ylöjärvi. He also recorded under the pseudonym Joel Sulo.

name: Tapio Lahtinen
comments: Composer, lyricist and translator from Helsinki who began his professional life as a jazz musician. Almost all of his works were written under pseudonyms.

name: Slim Green
comments: Obscure jazz guitarist and vocalist, not to be confused with the post-World War II blues singer of the same name.

name: Scatman Crothers
aliases: "Scat Man" Crothers with His Wild Cats
comments: R&B singer, guitarist, drummer, actor and voice-over actor

name: Charlie Gracie
comments: Charlie Gracie was one of the earliest rock 'n roll performers. He grew up in South Philadelphia and made his first record in 1951. His songs and guitar playing have been an influence on musicians world-wide.

name: The Palm Beach Boys Band
comments: Studio recording group ostensibly assembled by RCA Victor

name: Max Boyce
comments: Comedian, folk singer and entertainer from Glynneath, south Wales.

name: 4 Fiori Per Zoe
comments: Group from Bologna: Francesco Brini, Matteo Romagnoli, Nicola Manzan

name: Moltheni
comments: Alternative rock singer-songwriter from Sant’Elpidio a Mare

name: Mr.Grady?
comments: Trio of Alfredo Cappelli, Fabrizio Morganti & Saverio Lanza

name: Ivana Gatti
comments: Singer-songwriter and theremin player from Brescia

name: Acustimantico
comments: Group from Rome started by Stefano Scatozza

name: Ivo Robić
comments: Schlager singer. A pioneer of popular Yugoslavian music from the early 1950s on, Robić was an artist who successfully pursued both domestic and international careers for almost half a century.

name: Des O'Connor
comments: Singer, light entertainer and television presenter

name: Lorella Cuccarini
comments: Dancer, singer, TV host and actress.

name: The Hillbilly Moon Explosion
comments: Rockabilly band from Zürich fronted by Emanuela Hutter and Olivier Baroni

name: Alpha Centauri
comments: From Verona. Originally called Tornados. Line-up at the time of release of the single in 1969: o Mario Poletti (vocals) o Piero Messina (guitar) o Gianmaria Mingoni (keyboards) o Luciano Benedetti Vallenari (bass) o Francesco Casale (drums)

name: Anne van der Mark
comments: Post office employee in Kootstertille, but mainly known in Friesland as composer and songwriter both in Dutch and in Frisian.

name: Rypke Westra
aliases: Rypke Westra met orkest Û.L.F. Bert Paige

name: Jeff Katz
comments: Bubblegum pop producer and songwriter who worked together with Jerry Kasenetz as the Super K Productions company. The hitmaking duo have manufactured and produced 'Shadows of Knight', 'Kasenetz-Katz Singing Orchestral Circus', 'The Music Explosion', '1910 Fruitgum Company', 'Crazy Elephant' and 'The Ohio Express'.

name: Jerry Kasenetz
comments: Bubblegum pop producer and songwriter who worked together with Jeff Katz as the Super K Productions company. The hitmaking duo have manufactured and produced 'Shadows of Knight', 'Kasenetz-Katz Singing Orchestral Circus', 'The Music Explosion', '1910 Fruitgum Company', 'Crazy Elephant' and 'The Ohio Express'.

name: Daddy's Act
comments: Beat group from Den Haag and Amsterdam in the 1960s consisting of Leen Bouman, bass, Bart Terlaak, drums, Jan Jonkman jr., guitar and Ron Westerbeek, organ and piano.

name: Buffalo Bob and The Rinkelstars
comments: One-Time project by dutch Radio DJ's Rob Stenders & Jeroen van Inkel.

name: Tina Mason
comments: Pop music singer and TV hostess

name: Giancarlo Guardabassi
comments: Singer, lyricist, disc jockey, tv and radio presenter born in Foligno.

name: Harry Muskee
comments: Blues singer and songwriter, who was inducted in the 'Dutch Blues Hall of Fame' in 2011

name: Eelco Gelling
comments: Blues guitarist from Zwartsluis, Drenthe, who was inducted in the 'Dutch Blues Hall of Fame' in 2015

name: The Dubs
comments: Rhythm & blues vocal group from New York City. Members include Billy Carlisle, Richard Blandon, Tommy Grate, Cleveland Still and James Miller.

name: The Airedales
comments: Rock 'n' roll band assembled in 1958 by drummer Doug Fowlkes in Key West, Florida. Their name is US military slang for "Navy pilots": their original members were in fact all enlisted in the US Navy. In 1960 Fowlkes met fellow bluejacket, boxer and singer Charlie "Rocker" Roberts. Roberts and Fowlkes launched their musical collaboration while they were both stationed in Côte d'Azur. Their stay in France wasn't particularly rewarding, but when they moved to Italy they scored a string of hits as "Rocky Roberts & The Airedales". Meanwhile, the line-up had changed with the inclusion of, among others, bassist Wesley "Wess" Johnson, whereas Fowlkes stepped down from being the drummer and bandleader for a more behind-the-scene role as agent, producer and occasionally songwriter. Around 1967 Roberts started working with other backing musicians and Wess took over as lead singer.

name: Bruna Lelli
comments: Singer, active from the mid-1950s till the end of the 1970s.

name: Carlo
comments: Doo wop singer and drummer, best known as a member of Dion and The Belmonts. Over the years he has continued to collaborate with Dion DiMucci.

name: Svetlana Makarovič
comments: Slovenian poet, writer, actress, illustrator and chanteuse born in Maribor.

name: Mimma Gaspari
comments: Lyricist and music industry executive. Often shown on releases under her pseudonym of "Petaluma."

name: Horacio Ferrer
comments: Poet, broadcaster, reciter and tango lyricist born in Montevideo.

name: I nuovi angeli
comments: Pop/rock band known for their Italian language covers hits of English language originals.

name: Ken Jones
comments: Conductor, arranger, composer, producer and pianist

name: Jean-Pierre Gebler
comments: Primarily a baritone saxophonist, Gebler also recorded on piano.  He took an approximate 15 year hiatus from music between 1967 and 1982.

name: Yvonne Walter
comments: Jazz singer and songwriter.  For some two decades she performed under her birth name of de Kok before changing her surname to her mother's maiden name.

name: Graeme Bell
aliases: Graeme Bell and His All Stars
Graeme Bell and His Australian Jazz Band
Graeme Bell & His Australian Jazz Band
Graeme Bell and His Dixieland Band
Graeme Bell and His Dixieland Jazz Band
Graeme Bell & His Dixieland Jazz Band
Graeme Bell and His Ragtime Piano
comments: Jazz pianist, known best for playing Dixieland style.  Bell was also a composer and band leader.  He is sometimes referred to as the "Father of Australian Jazz". He is also co-founder of the Australian label Swaggie Records.

name: Ljubljanski Jazz Ansambel
comments: Jazz formation started by members of Plesni Orkestar RTV Ljubljana (the orchestra of the offical Slovene radio station)

name: Al Wingate
comments: Rockabilly singer, who recorded in the late 1950's, and songwriter.

name: Dean Beard
aliases: Dean Beard and The Crew Cats
Dean Beard with The Crew Cats
comments: Rockabilly performer from Santa Anna. Texas

name: Toxic Guineapigs
comments: Alt rock band based in Basel.

name: Ray Harris
comments: Rockabilly singer, guitarist, songwriter, producer and record label owner

name: Jack Six
comments: Double bass player performed as a sideman with several jazz artists, including Dave Brubeck .   Six also has written several classical compositions.

name: Phillip Swern
comments: Radio and record producer and composer

name: Kasim Sulton
comments: Vocalist, bassist, keyboardist. After his stint with Utopia, he continues to work with Todd Rundgren including being a member of Rundgren's touring ban, among other projects.

name: The Rock and Roll Dubble Bubble Trading Card Co. of Philadelphia - 19141
comments: Studio group created by producers Bob Feldman and Jerry Goldstein

name: Augusto Martelli
aliases: Bob Mitchell e la sua orchestra
comments: Composer, conductor, arranger and television personality

name: Rasul Gamzatov
comments: Poet from Tsada, Dagastan, in the north-east Caucasus and probably the most famous poet writing in the Avar language. Among his poems was Zhuravli, which became a well-known Soviet song.

name: Mark Bernes
comments: Popular singer and actor who was born in Нежин (Nizhyn), now in northern Ukraine on October 8, 1911 (Gregorian calendar; September 25 in the Julian calendar). In vocal style and popularity if not necessarily song subject matter, he can be seen as the Soviet equivalent of Bing Crosby or Frank Sinatra.

name: The Dee Jays
comments: Rock 'n' roll band, acting as the backing band of Australian singer Johnny O'Keefe.

name: George Chisholm
aliases: George Chisholm and His Jive Five
comments: Scottish jazz trombonist, who also had several film roles.

name: Tut Taylor
comments: Bluegrass banjo, dobro and mandolin player

name: Gaetano Amendola
comments: Neapolitan lyricist, who often wrote with Peppino Gagliardi with whom he wrote many successes

name: Claudio Natili
comments: Guitarist, songwriter, TV author and playwright.

name: I Santo California
comments: Pop band formed in 1974 and formerly known as La nuova frontiera.

name: Gregory Herbert
comments: Played saxophones, flute and piccolo, primarily in jazz configurations, although he did play briefly in Blood, Sweat & Tears . Herbert died of a drug overdose.

name: George Pringle
comments: Artist, music producer, Radio DJ, performer, writer and curator from London

name: Dave Most
comments: Songwriter, publisher and music promotion executive

name: Borney Bergantine
comments: Bandleader. While he wrote "My Happiness" in the 1930s and performed it live with his orchestra "The Happiness Boys", it was not recorded for many years.

name: Betty Peterson
comments: Her songwriting credit is suspect, being the wife of music publisher Louis Blasco.

name: The Marlin Sisters
comments: Vocal duo consisting of sisters, Gittele (Trudy) [1922 - 2006] and Goldele (Gloria) Malavsky [1923 - 1995]. They were daughters of the well-known Cantor, Samuel Malavsky. In addition to popular music they also recorded Yiddish, Cantorial and Liturgical music as a duo and as part of The Malavsky Family Choir. Eddie Fisher's first successful recording was made with the Marlin Sisters.

name: The Song Spinners
aliases: Dick Bryer and The Song Spinners
comments: American vocal group. They accompanied Dick Haymes, Bing Crosby, Ella Fitzgerald and other vocalists and had a #1 hit in 1943 with "Comin' in on a Wing and a Prayer".

name: John Laurenz
comments: Actor and pop vocalist from Brooklyn, New York

name: Dorothy Donegan
comments: Jazz pianist primarily known for performing in the stride piano and boogie-woogie style. She also played bebop, swing jazz, and classical music.

name: Farida
comments: After participating in various singing competitions under the pseudonym of Concetta "Ketty" Gangi, she landed in 1966 at the Festival degli sconosciuto in Ariccia , where she gained the attention of record companies for her interpretations and her vocal talent.

name: Vanilla Swingers
comments: Pop duo composed of Anne Gilpin and Miles Jackson.

name: Aleksei Kortnev
comments: Singer, songwriter, musician, theater, film and dubbing actor, screenwriter, composer, TV presenter

name: Amy Cervini
comments: Toronto born jazz and pop vocalist

name: Eithel Fuin
comments: Black metal band based in Modena.

name: Jack Montrose
comments: Jazz tenor saxophonist best known as a cool jazz player and arranger.

name: Roberto Negri
aliases: Roberto Negri e il suo pianoforte

name: Savoy Havana Band
comments: The house dance band of London's Savoy Hotel for most the 1920s.

name: The Pickens Sisters
comments: Trio sister singing act popular for about five years in the 1930s, during which they had their own radio program.

name: Meyer Davis
aliases: The Empire City Dance Orchestra – Dave Meyer's Bostonians
Meyer Davis' Hotel Astor Orchestra under direction of Joe Moss
comments: He was not only a bandleader but also a contractor, with often several bands under his name operating at the same time.

name: Brian Lawrance
aliases: Brian Lawrance and His Hot Five
Brian Lawrance and His Lansdowne House Sextet
Brian Lawrance and His Lansdowne Orchestra
Brian Lawrance and His Lansdowne Orchestra - Vocal Refrain by Brian Lawrance
Brian Lawrance and the Quaglino Quartet

name: Harry Roy
aliases: Harry Roy & His Bat Club Boys
Harry Roy & His Mayfair Hotel Orchestra
Harry Roy and His Orchestra from The Cafe Anglais
Harry Roy & His Orchestra from The Cafe Anglais
Harry Roy & His Orchestra from The May Fair Hotel
Harry Roy and His Tiger Ragamuffins
comments: Dance band bandleader, clarinetist, singer and songwriter

name: Smashing Potatoes
comments: Rock covers band specializing in Swiss folk music.

name: Jerry Jerome [US]
aliases: Jerry Jerome and All His Stars
Jerry Jerome and His Cats and Jammers
Jerry Jerome and His Country Club Orchestra ‎
comments: Primarily a jazz tenor saxophonist, Jerome also recorded on alto sax and clarinet.   Jerome worked as music director and conductor for television and radio orchestras.  Thereafter, he became successful writing advertising jingles.

name: Jo Jones
comments: Influential jazz drummer who played in many styles.  Not to be confused with the also influential drummer Philly Joe Jones .

name: Rocky Volcano
aliases: Rocky Volcano et ses Rock 'n' Rollers
Rocky Volcano et ses Rock n' Rollers
Rocky Volcano y sus Volcano Twisters

name: Tullio De Piscopo
aliases: Tullio De Piscopo Italian Jazz Machine
comments: Drummer, percussionist and singer born in Naples

name: Northern Kings
comments: Symphonic metal cover supergroup consisting of four well-known Finnish musicians: Jarkko Ahola from Teräsbetoni, ex-Dreamtale, Marco Hietala from Nightwish and Tarot, Tony Kakko from Sonata Arctica and Juha-Pekka Leppäluoto from Charon and Harmaja.

name: Matty Matlock
aliases: Matty Matlock and The Paducah Patrol
comments: Dixieland and swing saxophonist, clarinetist and arranger

name: Guy Sebastian
comments: Rock-pop singer-songwriter, who won Australian Idol in 2003

name: George Freeman
comments: Jazz guitarist; he has worked and recorded as a sideman with many well known jazz musicians, including a long association with Richard "Groove" Holmes .

name: Bob Cranshaw
comments: Jazz bassist who is most often heard as a sideman, recording and performing with leading jazz musicians.  Cranshaw is probably best known for his long association with Sonny Rollins , in whose working band Cranshaw has been a frequent member over a period of some 50 years.  Cranshaw was an early adopter of the electric bass.

name: Jimmy McPartland
aliases: Jimmy McPartland and His Dixieland Band
Jimmy McPartland and His Jazz Band
comments: Traditional jazz cornetist, trumpeter, and sometime singer. McPartland led his own bands on several occasions.
family: 22557[Spouse (1945-1970) Following their divorce, the McPartlands remained friends and played together until 1990. The couple remarried shortly before Jimmy's death.]

name: Joaquín Prieto
comments: Musician and songwriter, best known for writing "La novia".

name: Paddy Roberts
comments: South African-born songwriter, who had a hand in a number of hits in the UK in the 50s.

name: Aaron English
comments: Pop singer-songwriter and pianist previously based in Seattle, Washington, and more recently (2022) based in Nashville, Tennessee.

name: The RaZor Skyline
comments: Alt-Gothic band based in San Francisco, California

name: Omnibox
comments: Electro/EBM band based in Portland, Oregon.

name: Maya Casabianca
comments: Casablanca-born French singer, who moved to Paris with her family in the 1950s. From the end of the 1950s to mid-1960s, Casabianca recorded dozens of records for the Philips label, who tried to model her career after the success of Dalida. In 1970, she immigrated to Haifa, Israel.

name: Pat McGeegan
aliases: Pat McGeegan and The Big Four
comments: Singer born in Clones, County Monaghan. He competed for Ireland at the Eurovision Song Contest in 1968 with the song "Chance of a Lifetime", arriving in fourth place.

name: Szilárd Felhő
comments: "Szilárd Felhő" is Hungarian for "Solid cloud", so this is probably an alias

name: Kid Ory
aliases: Kid Ory and His Creole Band
Kid Ory and His Creole Dixieland Band
Kid Ory and His Creole Jazz Band
comments: Traditional jazz trombonist, vocalist and bandleader born in Laplace to a Louisiana French-speaking family.

name: Carrie Rodriguez
comments: Folk/country music singer-songwriter and musician from Austin, Texas

name: Singleton Palmer
aliases: Singleton Palmer and The Dixieland Band
Singleton Palmer and His Dixieland Band
comments: St. Louis based Dixieland tuba, bass player and bandleader

name: Patty Hurst Shifter
comments: Alt country music band based in Raleigh, North Carolina

name: Right the Stars
comments: Alt pop acoustic band based in Los Angeles.

name: Sexton Blake
comments: Alt pop band based in Portland, Oregon

name: Hysear Don Walker
comments: Soul and R&B music pianist and songwriter

name: Vic Ferrari Band
comments: Multi-piece rock band specializing in covers. There is no "Vic Ferrari", a name taken from the TV program "Taxi".

name: Larry Klein
comments: Musician, songwriter, record and soundtrack producer, and head of Strange Cargo, an imprint with Universal Music Group.

name: Red Richards
comments: Traditional jazz pianist and occasional vocalist.

name: Rude Awakening
comments: Power metal band based in Southern California

name: Perla
comments: Pop singer, who emigrated to Brazil in the early 1970s

name: Rachele Amenta
comments: Singer from Vittoria and contestant in TV talent show Io canto in 2011

name: Abbacadabra [FR]
comments: Cast of the French children's television series of the same name incorporating fairy tales with ABBA songs.

name: Ne Luumäet
comments: Punk band much in the style of The Ramones.

name: David Usher
comments: English-born Canadian musician, best-selling author, keynote speaker and activist, known as the lead singer of the alternative rock band Moist.

name: The Secret Sisters
comments: Americana duo of Laura and Lydia Rogers

name: Pate Mustajärvi
comments: Rock singer from Tampere, who is known as the vocalist, frontman and only original member of Popeda as well as a solo artist. In Tampere he is known as "Ikurin turbiini" ("the turbine of Ikuri)."

name: Patrick Adams
comments: Disco, soul and boogie producer, arranger, songwriter and musician from Harlem, New York City

name: Colt Ford
comments: Country music singer and rapper from Georgia

name: The Ten Tenors
comments: Also known as TTT or 'The TEN'. A music ensemble that has toured worldwide since its formation in 1995. The group is renowned for their reimagining of modern-day rock classics by artists such as Queen, Meat Loaf, AC/DC, Aerosmith, and Leonard Cohen. They also perform operatic arias, native Australian tunes and the hits of Broadway.

name: Alan Pasqua
comments: Although principally a jazz pianist, Pasqua has also recorded rock, pop, soul and movie soundtracks.  Pasqua is also a songwriter, including co-composition credits for the "CBS Evening News" theme.  He is currently the Chair of the USC Thornton School of Music's Jazz Studies Department.

name: Jack Sheldon
aliases: Jack Sheldon and His Exciting All-Star Big-Band
Jack Sheldon & His West Coast Friends
The Jazz Trumpet of Jack Sheldon
comments: Jazz trumpet player who became widely known in the 1950s through his association with the West Coast jazz movement.  Sheldon was also a singer, actor, voice actor and comic.

name: Lars Gullin
comments: Jazz baritone player, pianist and composer

name: Mike Egan
comments: Scottish songwriter/composer, now living in Belgium.

name: Kamelot
comments: Power metal band based in Florida; formed in 1991.

name: Wardog
comments: Heavy metal/power metal band from Phoenix, Arizona.

name: Stuck Mojo
comments: Rap metal band based in Atlanta, Georgia; formed in 1989.

name: The Singers Unlimited
comments: Vocal group founded in 1967 by Gene Puerling, who had also formed The Hi-Lo's .  The group included Len Dresslar who is best known as the Jolly Green Giant from the commercial for the brand's frozen vegetables.  Indeed, the group initially made its money from jingles and commercials.  In 1971, the group began making jazz vocal recordings.

name: Billy Parker
comments: Country music singer, guitarist and disc jockey from Oklahoma

name: Isao Suzuki
comments: Jazz multi-instrumentalist who records primarily on bass.  Suzuki is also a composer, arranger, producer and bandleader.

name: The Sundowners [US1]
comments: Open band for the members of the Drag City label.

name: Martin Sherman
comments: Playwright and screenwriter. Sherman’s best-known work is Bent , one of the most influential gay-themed plays in theatrical history.

name: Teach-In
comments: Pop band best known for winning the Eurovision Song Contest in 1975 with the song "Ding-A-Dong"

name: beFour
comments: The 'product' of a docu soap which was broadcast in 2007 by the German Super RTL TV channel. Sales of their releases topped a million copies.

name: Sir Charles Thompson
aliases: Sir Charles and His All Stars
comments: Swing and bop pianist and organist. He was dubbed "Sir" by Lester Young

name: Crazy Frog
comments: Computer animated frog that starred in Jamba! commercials. The human source of its voice (if there is one) is unknown.

name: Lotterboys
comments: Electro/house music supergroup: Fetisch (Bergmann), Mack Goudy, Shapemod (Sebastian Müller).

name: West End Girls [SE]
comments: Pet Shop Boys tribute duo. Originally consisting of Isabelle Erkendal and Rosanna Jirebeck. Jirebeck left in 2008 and was replaced by Isabelle Erkendal's cousin Emmeli Erkendal.

name: Larz Kristerz
comments: Dansband founded in Älvdalen. Winner of the 2008 Dansbandskampen contest.

name: Gunter Wüsthoff
comments: Keyboarder/Synthesizer player, saxophonist. These days a painter and techical journalist.

name: Charlie Poole
comments: Pioneering country music recording artist, banjoist, singer, and entertainer from North Carolina

name: Billy Bang
comments: Progressive jazz, free jazz, avant-garde violinist and composer.  Bang studied violin early in his life, but he initially did not pursue it.  He was drafted at 18 while still in high school, opting to go into the military rather than seek a student deferment.  Bang was sent to Vietnam where he was involved in combat.  In 1968, Bang resumed playing violin.

name: Mijares
comments: Pop singer born in Mexico City

name: Swift [US2]
comments: Thrash/metal band based in North Carolina

name: Matthew Gee
comments: Bebop trombonist who mostly recorded as a sideman.

name: Monty Sunshine
aliases: Monty Sunshine His Clarinet and His Band
comments: Traditional jazz clarinetist who occasionally sang.

name: Harry Connick, Sr.
comments: District attorney for the Parrish of Orleans (New Orleans) from 1973 to 2003.  He was also a club singer, and later recorded as a swing vocalist.

name: Luca
comments: Multi-instrumentalist, singer/songwriter based in Tuscon, Arizona.  Luca has many credits as a session musician.

name: Dofka
comments: Thrash/power metal band based in Cleveland, Ohio

name: Conquest [FI]
comments: A hard rock/ heavy metal and progressive rock band originally active from 1998 until 2002. The band reunited in 2011 with a new line-up and is currently active again.

name: Error 7
comments: Duo formed by Pat Lachman (Guitar, bass and voice) and Dan Laudo (Drums)

name: Zebulon [SE]
comments: Band consisting of Håkan Morberg, Jojje Bohlin, Klas Morberg and Thomas Johnson.

name: Las Cruces
comments: Doom metal band from San Antonio, Texas

name: Solstice
comments: Epic heavy metal band from Yorkshire

name: 3JS
comments: Band from Volendam originally consisting of Jaap Kwakman, Jan Dulles (real name: Jan Keuken) and Jaap de Witte (real name:  Jaap Schilder). The name of the band is based on the first names of the three members. Jaap de Witte left the band in the beginning of 2013 and was replaced by his son Jan. The band represented The Netherlands  at the Eurovision Song Contest 2011 in Germany.

name: Pekka Myllykoski
comments: Singer, band leader, songwriter and lyrics translator.

name: Carol Burnett
comments: Carol Burnett starred on Broadway in 1959-1960 in the musical "Once Upon a Mattress", and released several records as a popular singer in the 1960s.  Burnett is best known for her long running television variety and comedy sketch show, although she has also been seen in many other television and film roles.

name: Maria Farantouri
comments: Singer and also a political and cultural activist. She has collaborated with prominent Greek composers such as Mikis Theodorakis , who wrote the score for Pablo Neruda's Canto General, in which Farantouri performed. She was also a member of the Greek parliament for the Socialist party (1990 - 1993).

name: Johnny Mars
comments: Electric blues vocalist, harmonica player, band leader

name: Eleven Hundred Springs
comments: Country music band from Dallas, Texas.

name: Rod Mason
aliases: Rod Mason and His Hot Five

name: Eddie Pennington
comments: Pennington is a funeral director and folk guitarist from Kentucky who plays thumbpicking style and sometimes sings.  He is heavily influenced by the guitar playing style of fellow Kentuckian Merle Travis .

name: Diamond Rexx
comments: Originally a metal/glam band, they have evolved into a thrash metal band.

name: Bjørn Nessjø
comments: Record producer, engineer and musician (mainly keyboards and bass guitar)

name: TNT
comments: Metal / hard rock band based in Trondheim

name: Scale Model
comments: Alt rock/pop band based in Nashville, Tennessee.

name: Rhythm Method
comments: Mixed a cappella group from Binghamton University (New York)

name: Preternatural
comments: Death metal band from Riga, active since 1999.

name: Magnet [GB1]
comments: Studio band, formed for the purpose of recording the soundtrack to the film The Wicker Man.

name: Milly Scott
comments: Pop and jazz singer and actress of Surinamese origin, best known for her participation in the 1966 Eurovision Song Contest. Scott is recognized as the first black singer to take part in Eurovision.

name: Bebe Neuwirth
comments: Two-time Tony winning Broadway actress, singer and dancer. On television, she played Lilith Sternin, Frasier Crane's wife, on both the TV sitcom "Cheers" (in a starring role) and its spin-off "Frasier" (in a recurring guest role). The role won her two Emmy Awards.

name: Allison Williams [US2]
comments: Broadway actress in the late 1970s to the early 1990s. Not to be confused with the younger film actress Allison Williams born in 1988.

name: Shirley MacLaine
comments: Film and theater actress, singer and dancer

name: The Ritchie Family
comments: Vocal group based in Philadelphia and successful in the 1970s during the disco era

name: The Hooters
comments: Rock band from Philadelphia. Their music is a blend rock and roll, reggae, ska and folk music.

name: Guild of Ages
comments: Hard rock band from Denver, Colorado. They were formerly known as C.I.T.A.

name: Mike Richmond
comments: Jazz bassist and educator, Richmond is on the faculty of New York University.

name: Sanctus Real
comments: Christian alt rock band. They were formed in 1996 in Toledo, Ohio.

name: Starfield
comments: Christian rock band based in Winnipeg.

name: TobyMac
comments: Singer-songwriter and producer and one of the first Christian rappers

name: Rob Schneiderman
comments: In addition to being a jazz pianist, Schneiderman has a doctorate in mathematics and teaches mathematics to college students.  He has also taught jazz.

name: GRITS
comments: Christian hip hop duo based in Nashville, Tennessee. Their name stands for "Grammatical Revolution In The Spirit".

name: Deanna Johnston
comments: Singer from Kingston, Ontario. Contestant at reality show Rock Star: INXS in 2005, where she placed seventh

name: Jessica Robinson
comments: Singer of Chicago band Covergürl and contestant in talent TV show Rock Star: INXS

name: Spoo-Key
comments: House music project of Harald Reitinger and Ulrich Fischer

name: Didi Zill
comments: Musician, and later a photographer specializing in the rock/pop scene.

name: Harvey Fuqua
comments: R&B/doo-wop singer, songwriter and record producer.

name: Andy Galea
comments: DJ & electronic music producer from London

name: Eddie Van Halen
comments: Hard rock musician, songwriter, producer and inventor

name: Dan Lacksman
comments: Synthesizer devotee who has had three major stages in his career: first as a solo artist (with Dan Lacksman Association), then as a member of Telex and lastly as a producer and sound-engineer for a lot of project in the 1990s.

name: Gilbert Gabriel
comments: Songwriter, film composer, producer and lecturer

name: Steve Morse
comments: Guitarist and composer. Voted "Best Guitarist" by Guitar Player magazine five times.

name: Gérard Manset
comments: Singer, songwriter, painter, photographer and writer

name: Stevie Ray Vaughan
comments: Blues guitarist, singer, songwriter and record producer. He is widely considered one of the most influential electric guitarists in the history of blues music, and one of the most important figures in the revival of blues in the 1980s.

name: George David Weiss
comments: Composer and lyricist.  Weiss was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1984 and was the president of the SHoF for several years.

name: Bob Thiele
aliases: Bob Thiele and His New Happy Times Orchestra
Bob Thiele & His New Happy Times Orchestra
comments: Record producer of some of the classic jazz albums and songwriter.  He also released records under his own name; however, on these recordings he was the musical director and not actually heard on them.

name: Rick Nowels
comments: A prolific songwriter since the age of 13, who has co-written over 60 Top 20 singles worldwide, including  "Heaven is a Place on Earth" and "Circle in the Sand" among the most notable. His breakthrough came when Stevie Nicks heard his songs and teamed with him in writing "Rooms on Fire". Other credits include “The Power of Goodbye” and “White Flag” with Dido, for which he received an Ivor Novello award. In 2022 he's inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame.

name: Eric Bell
comments: Belfast, Northern Ireland, born guitarist and founding member of Thin Lizzy.

name: Ronnie Lane
aliases: Ronnie Lane accompanied by the band "Slim Chance"
comments: Rock musician, best known as a bassist, songwriter and record producer.  Lane suffered from multiple sclerosis for 21 years, which ultimately killed him at the age of 51.

name: Jerry Ragovoy
comments: Songwriter and record producer originally from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. In 1953 he co-founded the Grand label with Herb Slotkin, the manager of Treegoobs, an appliance store in West Philly. This was the start of the early Philly R&B group sound. Ragovoy recorded the Castelles, Lee Andrews and the Hearts, the Cherokees as well as non group R&B performers including Chris Powell and the Tri-Tones. Later in the 1950s he worked with the Philly-based Chancellor Records. By the 1960s he wrote "Cry Baby," "Piece of My Heart," and "Time Is on My Side" and he became East Coast head of A&R for Warner Bros. Ragovoy used the pseudonym "Norman Meade" for Time Is on My Side , and the alias "Norman Margulies" for registering A Wonderful Dream .

name: Fred Ebb
comments: Musical theater lyricist who was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1983

name: John Kander
comments: Composer of a number of musicals as part of the songwriting team of Kander and Ebb. His best-known stage musicals are Cabaret and Chicago, both of which were later adapted into films. He was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1983.

name: Paul Williams [US1]
comments: Singer, songwriter and actor. He has won an Oscar Award, two Golden Globe Awards and three Grammy Awards and is President and chairman of ASCAP since 2009. He received a "Johnny Mercer Award" in 2022.

name: Ken Ascher
comments: Keyboardist, pianist, arranger, producer, songwriter and composer

name: Tommy Boyce
comments: Best known as a pop songwriter, he was also a performer

name: Brian Nash
comments: Musician (guitar), author and actor, who was the guitarist of the 1980s band Frankie Goes to Hollywood

name: Josh White
comments: Influential blues/folk singer and guitarist.  In the 1940s, White was perhaps the closest African American friend of President Franklin Roosevelt. In the 1950s, White's activism for civil and human rights made him a target of the House Un-American Activities Committee in front of which he testified, denouncing Communism. Although a "friendly" witness, White's testimony led to his blacklisting. On his 1930s recordings his blues (not gospel) recording were credited to his Pinewood Tom alias as that was the "devil's music".

name: John "Speedy" Keen
comments: Guitarist, drummer, singer, songwriter and producer.

name: Jazzie B
comments: British DJ, music producer and entrepreneur.

name: Gary Barlow
comments: Singer, pianist, songwriter and record producer

name: Jock McDonald
comments: Punk rock music singer, DJ, promoter and manager

name: Leo Luoto
comments: Singer and musician. Sweden-born and living son of Finnish immigrants. Only performing in Finnish.

name: Rita
comments: Hebrew: ריטה יהאן-פרוז‎, Persian: ریتا جهان‌فروز‎;

name: Tutu Puoane
comments: Jazz singer and composer based in Belgium. She is married to pianist, composer Ewout Pierreux.

name: Enola Quintet
comments: Jazz unit led by Mitsukuni Murayama.

name: Demolition String Band
comments: Alternative country/country-rock band from Hoboken, NJ, comprised of members Elena Skye (vocals) and Boo Reiners (guitar).

name: Ansambl Aleksandrova
comments: The official choir of the Russian armed forces with accompanying orchestra and dancers. Its current proper name is: Дважды краснознаменный академический ансамбль песни и пляски Российской армии имени А. В. Александрова [Dvazhdy krasnoznamenny akademichesky ansambl pesni i plyaski Rossiyskoy armii imeni A. V. Aleksandrova].

name: Beegie Adair
comments: Award-winning jazz pianist and arranger known for her interpretations of jazz and popular standards and show tunes

name: Joe Bishop
comments: Jazz multi-instrumentalist (piano, trumpet, tuba, flugelhorn, and mellophone) and songwriter.

name: Zmrzlina
comments: Post-punk group based in San Francisco.

name: Milk Chopper
comments: Short-lived indie-pop band from San Francisco who self-released an album in 2002.

name: Creeper Lagoon
comments: Indie rock band from San Francisco.

name: Richard Buckner
comments: Sources differ on whether this alt-country singer-songwriter was born in Fresno in 1964 or in San Francisco in 1967. After living in Edmonton, Alberta, for a number of years, he relocated to Brooklyn, New York. He is now living in upstate New York.

name: Mooseheart Faith
comments: Band based in Los Angeles, California

name: The Miracle Workers
comments: Garage rock band from Portland, OR

name: Roy Loney
aliases: Roy Loney and The Phantom Movers
Roy Loney and The Young Fresh Fellows

name: The Odds
comments: Garage punk band from Worcester, MA.

name: Brigitte Derks
comments: Actress, choreographer. Mother of Ian Thomas [BE]

name: Jerry Marcellino
comments: Soul and disco songwriter and producer.

name: Jack Palmer [US1]
comments: Self-educated pianist and composer. Working as a Tin Pan Alley staff writer, Palmer co-wrote dozens of songs, many for motion picture soundtracks.

name: Bennie Krueger
aliases: Bennie Krueger & His Orch. – Vocal Chorus by Dick Robertson

name: Aileen Stanley
comments: Singer of popular songs from Chicago, who commenced recording in 1920.  She had earlier been part of the vaudville duo, Stanley and Aileen, with her brother Stanley. After her brother left the act Aileen started performing solo creating her alias  by reversing the name of the old family billing. She performed in vaudeville and cabarets and in 1920 she was a hit in New York City in the revue show "Silks and Satins" and made the first of her numerous recordings the same year. She moved to the UK in 1931 recording in London between 1934 and 1937.

name: Guy Roche
comments: Songwriter, arranger, producer, keyboardist and pianist

name: Reggae Disco Rockers
comments: Reggae-pop band consisting of Kitetsu Takamiya, Tetsu Nishiuchi and Youta Kobayashi. Although considered an official member, singer Mika Arisaka si sometimes credited as a guest vocalist or joined/replaced by other singers.

name: Anthony Ortega
comments: Jazz saxophonist, clarinetist, flutist, bandleader and composer born in Los Angeles

name: Gravity [US1]
comments: Alt-rock band based in Denver, Colorado

name: Kevin Chalfant
comments: Singer, songwriter, and entertainer from Streator, Illinois.

name: Frank Hewitt
comments: Relatively obscure bop pianist.  Hewitt lived his entire life in New York City.  He played live with major jazz artists, but was not recorded until 1998, and only one track was released before his death.

name: Mimi Fox
comments: Jazz guitarist, composer and teacher born in New York City

name: Twoinone
comments: House music duo of Petra Suk and DJ Man (George Alaba).

name: Hayden Tee
comments: New Zealand-born singer-actor known for his work in musical theatre

name: Red Aunts
comments: All female punk band from Long Beach,

name: Jerry Bergonzi
comments: Jazz multi-instrumentalist who primarily records on tenor saxophone.  Bergonzi is also a songwriter and an author of several books on playing music. He has been on faculty with the New England Conservatory of Music since 1986.

name: Don Thompson
aliases: Don Thompson's Banff Jazz All Stars
comments: Multi-instrumental jazz musician, including bass, piano, and vibes.  Thompson has recorded as a leader, co-leader, featured soloist and sideman and is established as part of the Toronto jazz scene.  He has won several Juno Awards, which is Canada's equivalent of the Grammy Awards in the United States.

name: Terry Clarke [CA]
comments: Jazz drummer who has recorded as a featured player and sideman.

name: Granfaloon Bus
comments: Alt Country band from San Diego, active 1990-2002.

name: The Crooked Jades
comments: Old-time bluegrass band from San Francisco.

name: Clea Bradford
comments: Vocalist who sang in jazz, blues, soul, and traditional pop styles

name: Nicole Morier
comments: Electropop singer-songwriter and produce from San Francisco.

name: Tru-la-lá
comments: Dance music set. It is part of the musical culture of the city of Córdoba, which has been called "La Música de Cuarteto" or "Cuartetazo" and which recognizes its origins in the mid-20th century.

name: Abacay
comments: Pop duo composed of Melany Morganstern and Miles Torrance

name: The Octopodes
comments: Coed a cappella group from Johns Hopkins University (Baltimore, Maryland)

name: Caater
comments: Trance music duo from Tallinn, Kalle Kukk and Marku Tiidumaa.

name: Evildead
comments: Thrash metal band from Los Angeles

name: Peter Marshall
comments: TV/radio personality, actor and singer born in Huntington, West Virginia

name: Cees Slinger
aliases: Cees Slinger, His Trios and Guests

name: Al Goodhart
comments: In his working life, he was involved in many aspects of the entertainment business, working as a vaudeville pianist and radio announcer, as well as writing songs and owning a theatrical agency.

name: Frank McComb
comments: Keyboardist, contemporary jazz and soul singer and songwriter.

name: Rebecka Törnqvist
comments: Jazz and pop vocalist. She also plays percussion and keyboards

name: Bo Sundström
comments: Singer and songwriter. Best known for being the leader and vocalist of Bo Kaspers orkester.

name: Tomás Fundora
comments: Miami, Florida-based producer, songwriter, and record label owner.

name: Wave Mechanics Union
comments: Modern big band covering progressive rock, classic rock, and American and British popular music

name: Marilina Ross
comments: Marilina Ross (born María Celina Parrondo, Liniers, Buenos Aires) is a singer and actress. She went into exile in Spain during the years of the military dictatorship (1976–1983), because this would not allow her to develop her artistic activities in Argentina.

name: Jiřina Fikejzová
comments: Lyricist born in Lom u Mostu (north-western Bohemia). When she was young, she also performed with a band and was a successful runner.

name: Helios Creed
comments: Guitarist and singer, most well-known as a member of Chrome.

name: Cook da Books
comments: British new wave band from Liverpool, popular in the 1980s.

name: Marcela Mitz
comments: Lyricist of many of singer Clémentine's early songs

name: World Classic Rockers
comments: Rock band formed in 1999 by several legendary rock musicians who have played with some of the top bands of the last 35 years.

name: Sweetwater [1]
comments: Formed in 1968.  Sweetwater was the first band to play at the 1969 Woodstock festival, coming on after Richie Havens completed his solo set.

name: Lenny Breau
comments: Jazz guitarist; he was murdered by strangulation

name: Trick or Treat
comments: Italian power metal band, originally a Helloween tribute act

name: 1000 Mona Lisas
comments: Punk band from Hollywood, California, active in the 1990s

name: Heroina
comments: One-off studio project by Hamburg musicians Matthias Arfmann (vocals), Tobias Gruben (vocals) and Gün Yan-Sen (electronics), Katrin Achinger (vocals, bass), Emilio Winschetti, and Rüdiger Klose.

name: Civilla D. Martin
comments: Writer of religious hymns and gospel songs.

name: Joseph Webster
comments: He composed and performed po­pu­lar mu­sic. He studied with Lo­well Ma­son and was ac­tive mu­sic­al­ly in New York, New Jer­sey and Con­nec­ti­cut, and directed a quartet com­pa­ny called the Eu­ter­pe­ans. In 1851, he moved to Mad­i­son, In­di­a­na, followed by Chi­ca­go, Il­li­nois (1855); Ra­cine, Wis­con­sin (1856); and finally Elk­horn, Wis­con­sin (1857). Webster wrote over a thou­sand bal­lads and ma­ny hymns.

name: Fillmore Bennett
comments: His poetry began appearing in the Wau­ke­gan, Il­li­nois, Ga­zette in the early 1850’s. In 1860 he moved to Elk­horn, Wis­con­sin, and became as­so­ci­ate ed­it­or of the Elk­horn In­de­pen­dent. In the Am­er­i­can civil war, Ben­nett served in the 40th Wis­con­sin Volunteers. Upon re­turn to Elk­horn, he ran a drug­store and studied med­i­cine. Graduating from Rush Med­i­cal Col­lege in 1874, he worked as a doc­tor for ov­er two de­cades. He wrote the lyrics of more than 85 hymns.

name: Mardi Gras.BB
comments: Big band from Mannheim crossing over between genres. Founded a. o. by ex-Guru Guru bassist/sousaphonist Uli Krug and guitarist/singer/arranger/main songwriter Dr. Jochen Wenz. The number of band members varied between 7 and 13 and Wenz left in 2013.

name: Pete Drake
aliases: Pete Drake and His Talking Steel Guitar
comments: Nashville-based record producer, record label founder and pedal steel guitar player

name: Lynn Kellogg
comments: Actor and singer. She lived in the Ozarks and singing Christian music. Kellogg played the role of "Shelia" in the Broadway production of Hair .

name: Akiko Wada
comments: Singer and television personality, nicknamed "Akko" or "Jotei" (empress).

name: Arnold Wilkerson
comments: Wilkerson had a relatively short career supporting himself as a performer in musical theater.  His career went into a slump in the early-1970s, and he largely supported himself as a waiter.  He is the co-founder of the Little Pie Company, a popular bakery in New York City that specializes in pies.

name: Mondo Drag
comments: Electro artist based in Denver, Colorado.

name: Delobbo
comments: Music producer, photographer & writer from Chicago

name: The Encomium Effect
comments: Alias used for recording Depeche Mode covers in MODEified records

name: Ron Moody [GB]
comments: Actor, mostly in films, although probably best known for his role as Fagin in Oliver! .  Moody is also a singer and composer.

name: dMentia
comments: Acoustic covers duo, Syncrus Magnificus and Marcos Penalosa. They specialize in covering electronic music.

name: Babyshambles
comments: Alt rock band formed in 2003 in London by Pete Doherty.

name: Umberto Balsamo
comments: Singer-songwriter best known for his hit singles "Balla" and "L'angelo azzurro".

name: Salvatore Fabrizio
comments: Singer, songwriter, producer and A&R executive.

name: Jari Lappalainen
comments: Session musician born in Kuopio. His main instrument is the violin, but he also plays mandolin, guitar and bass. Between 1969 and 1978 he also released solo records as a singer.

name: Daniel Aeschliman
comments: Vocalist who participated in a tribute album for Depeche Mode.

name: Michael Jeffries
comments: Pop and R&B singer-songwriter and musician

name: Teknique
comments: Three members band from San Diego

name: Null Device
comments: Electro/industrial project based in Madison, Wisconsin. Its principles are Eric Oehler and Erick Goedken.

name: Barbara Lea
comments: Jazz and popular singer and stage actress

name: Martha Miyake
comments: Chinese born jazz singer who sings in English
